subject: Photography
title: Dorothea Lange
description: A quick, practical guide to Dorothea Lange.

hook.text: She photographed suffering with such dignity that a nation's conscience shifted. Dorothea Lange changed America.

buildup.text: Lange documented the Great Depression for the Farm Security Administration, traveling across rural America.

discovery.text: Her 'Migrant Mother' â€” Florence Owens Thompson â€” became the face of economic despair and human resilience.

twist.text: Thompson later resented the fame. She received no money and felt exploited by the image that fed thousands.

climax.text: Lange proved photographs could be political action. Her images triggered government aid to migrant camps.

punchline.text: She turned a camera into a weapon against poverty.

quiz.question: What was the real-world impact of Lange's 'Migrant Mother'?
